Welcome to Western's Sehome Hill Arboretum Website!

About

Not far from the shores of Bellingham Bay and rising above the old town of Bellingham Washington lies a lush green forest. The 175.5 acres of the Sehome Hill Arboretum are dedicated to a Pacific Northwest natural environment. It is a preserve, a park, a home, and a respite from the bustle of university and city life.

On This Website, You’ll Find Information About:

  • The life sustained by the hill
  • The unique geological fingerprint of the Arboretum
  • How the Arboretum functions in the local community

After decades of conservation, the Arboretum is mixed terrain and is here for a nice stroll, a great hike, or simply escaping for the day. The Arboretum will exist for decades to come, and has existed in its current state for well over a century. We hope to encourage ecological restoration of the 175.5 acre area as a "New Old Growth Forest" where nature will define your paths to cross and experience all that the Arboretum has to offer.

Mission Statement

"The Sehome Hill Arboretum is conceived of as a natural area devoted to educational, aesthetic, recreational and research purposes; and all development shall be compatible with this ecological concept.”

Something for Everyone at the Arboretum!

  • Students - listen to the sounds of nature as you study.
  • Hikers - appreciate the multitude of trails while you enjoy the scenery.
  • Families - enjoy the different birds and other animals who make the Arboretum their home.
  • Retirees - take time to enjoy nature. You deserve it!

Western Run Website

This website has been designed and written by Western Washington University (WWU) students, faculty, and staff to showcase the Sehome Hill Arboretum. We hope you enjoy exploring these links and learning about the Arboretum just as we have.
